content.description:
Start on the undercling and small edge in the middle of the boulder. Make a large move to a very small but positive crimp from here work the feet to get to a large jug. The second half of the problem involves a slopey pinch and some positive edges to reach the lip.

Again, if anything is known about FA or name, please add!

This is a fun boulder to work on some contact strength.
content.location: Start in the middle of the boulder, and work up and right to a topout between the two overhanging prows on this boulder.

content.description:
Stand start on the large pocket and a sidepull (or just the pocket for more challenge). Make a move up to a cluster of positive crimps. Make a big move to another good jug, and then top out via a mantel at the lip over the prow of the boulder.

This is good fun on surprisingly big holds!

Please add more info on FA and name as known.
content.protection: A pad or two is good.
content.location: Start off the pocket on the left side of the face.
